name: Double Free
description:
A double free vulnerability is a variant of a use-after-free (UAF) vulnerability, and it occurs when a pointer is free()'d after it has already been free()'d. This can lead to numerous issues, including poisoning the target system's freelist, or introducing a use-after-free (UAF) on the re-allocated pointer.

They can be exploited to achieve memory corruption, DoS, and ultimately arbitrary code execution in some cases.
